benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/accounts/{childAccountId}/transferCredit - Move a given child credit to the parent level

covered: Valid Request: Happy-path transfers (TC01) and backward compatibility (TC17) are covered; audit logs coverage (TC02).
Error Handling & Validation: Comprehensive coverage for missing/invalid headers (TC06, TC07, TC11, TC15), missing accounts (TC04, TC12), missing parent (TC05), and authorization issues (TC10).
Not Found / Missing Resources: Child or parent account not found scenarios (TC04, TC05, TC12).
Authorization & Security: Unauthorized access (TC10) and injection/malicious payload tests (TC11).
Concurrency & Idempotency: Concurrent transfers (TC14) and double-transfer regression (TC16).
Performance & Scale: Large dataset scenario (TC13) and timing checks.
Audit Logs: Transfer reason/comment auditing tested (TC02).
Header Handling: Extra headers ignored test (TC08).
gaps: Partial Update semantics: No explicit test for rejecting partial PUT updates or payload-driven partial updates.
Rate Limiting: No tests for throttling or rate-limiting behavior.
Caching: No tests validating caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control).
Payload Validation on body: No explicit tests for invalid data types or missing fields in a request body (if body is required).
Missing/variant auth: Additional authorization roles/claims beyond basic 401/403 not tested.
recommendations: Add rate-limiting tests and simulate bursts to ensure proper throttling behavior.
Add caching headers validation, ensuring ETag handling and Cache-Control correctness.
Include tests for partial/invalid payloads in the request body if a body is used by the API (e.g., invalid numeric types or missing fields).
Add explicit test for idempotent PUT: repeated identical transfers do not over-credit or under-credit beyond expected semantics (confirm TC16 semantics).
Expand negative tests around authorization with different roles or permissions to ensure proper access control.
Document and test edge cases for extremely large datasets with pagination or streaming if applicable.
